column1: This year is the 10 year anniversary of Lost, so I was thinking since Jimmy Kimmel is a major Lost fan himself he could maybe host a reunion with the entire cast and creators on his show!!???
MY FRIEND WAS ON NATIONAL TELEVISION LAST NIGHT this is cool

Soul music’s rising star Charles Bradley continues to bring his riveting, lauded live show to fans across the globe, including a sold out show this past weekend at Los Angeles’ Fonda Theatre. On Monday, May 19th, Bradley & His Extraordinaires also brought the their live show into millions of US homes with a performance on ABC’s Jimmy Kimmel Live!

By now, Bradley’s remarkable, against-all-odds rise has been well documented: how he transcended a bleak life on the streets and struggled through a series of ill-fitting jobs before finally being discovered by Daptone’s Gabriel Roth. The documentary Charles Bradley: Soul of America, directed by Poull Brien, follows Bradley’s extraordinary journey during the electrifying and transformative months leading up to the release of 2011 debut album No Time for Dreaming.
Watch Bradley’s soul-stirring rendition of “You Put The Flame On It” above, from the latest album Victim of Love, out now on Daptone Records.
